concept.title: GCCOINCIDENT Command
concept.shortdesc: Creates a coincident geometric constraint on 2D entities.

conbody.p: Create a coincident constraint to ensure a point on an entity remains coincident with a specified point or entity.

section.title: Methods to create a coincident constraint
section.p: There are three methods to begin creating a coincident constraint:

dlentry.dd: Begin creating a coincident constraint by specifying a point on an entity then:
Specify a point on an entity to make coincident with the first point. The point on the first entity maintains its position while the second entity adjusts, as necessary, to become coincident.
Begin creating a coincident contraint by selecting an entity then:
Specify a point on an entity to make coincident with the first entity. The first entity maintains its position while the point on the second entity adjusts, as necessary, to become coincident.
Create coincident constraints by selecting all entities to which you want to apply relevant coincident constraints.

section.title: Options within the GCCOINCIDENT command
section.p: After you begin creating a coincident constraint, the following option may be available:

dlentry.dd: Create multiple coincident constraints until you press Enter to end the command.
